column4: Hey .. I have installed the ubuntu 9.04 new fresh and i used to use 8.10 but my hard drive still EXT3 could help me to change it to EXT4
you will have to do that through the 9.04 liveCD
could you tell me how or just give me a tutorial about it ? and what is the different i will get ?
sure see: http://ext4.wiki.kernel.org/index.php/Ext4_Howto#Converting_an_ext3_filesystem_to_ext4
THNKS :)
I do not think you will notice a difference.
make sure you do not run those commands on a mounted partition- OK? that could be dangerous for your data.
:S
oky i was just going to do it !
brb i will restart c ya
liveCD :P
yep ;)
i think what is need just to run liveCD write the command "tune2fs -O extents,uninit_bg,dir_index /dev/DEV" then the command "e2fsck -fD /dev/DEV" Right ?
silentx- yep except replace DEV with your filesystemm (e.g, mine was dsb3)
silentX: *sdb3 - check out system > administration > disk partitioner for more info on your partitions
loooooolz i got lost with dsb :S
oky i will now :D
jerome: what is preseed?
as i have here EXT3 >> /dev/sda1 -- Extended /dev/sda2 -- linux swap >> /dev/sda5 "" i think my target is sda1""
Right ?
sounds like it. does the size look right?
